00038 // Static members of the Socket class
00039 Socket::DynamicNameSolvingType Socket::GetDynamicNameSolving()
00040 {
00041     static DynamicNameSolvingType DynamicNameSolving = OMISCIDNS_UNSET;
00042
00043     if ( DynamicNameSolving == OMISCIDNS_UNSET )
00044     {
00045         char * Option = getenv( "OMISCIDNS_USE_MDNS_NAME_SOLVING" );
00046         if ( Option == NULL )
00047         {
00048             DynamicNameSolving = OMISCIDNS_USE_DNS_ONLY;
00049             OmiscidTrace( "OMISCIDNS_USE_DNS_ONLY found. Use standard DNS for name solving.\n" );
00050         }
00051         else
00052         {
00053             DynamicNameSolving = OMISCIDNS_USE_MDNS_NAME_SOLVING;
00054             OmiscidTrace( "OMISCIDNS_USE_MDNS_NAME_SOLVING found. Use mDNS for name solving." );
00055         }
00056     }
00057
00058     return DynamicNameSolving;
00059 }

00061 Socket::Socket()
00062 : socketType(SOCKET_KIND_UNDEFINED), descriptor((SOCKET)SOCKET_ERROR)

00065 Socket::Socket(SocketKind type)
00066 : socketType(type), descriptor((SOCKET)SOCKET_ERROR)
00067 {
00068     if((descriptor = socket(AF_INET, type, 0)) == SOCKET_ERROR)
00069     {
00070         throw SocketException("socket", Errno());
00071     }
00072 }

00089 void Socket::SetDescriptor(SOCKET descr)
00090 {
00091     descriptor = descr;
00092     int t;
00093     int size = sizeof(int);
00094
00095     if(getsockopt(descriptor, SOL_SOCKET,SO_TYPE , (char*)&t, (socklen_t*)&size) == SOCKET_ERROR)
00096     {
00097         throw SocketException("getsockopt", Errno());
00098     }
00099
00100     socketType = (SocketKind)t;
00101     //   if(socketType == TCP)
00102     //   {
00103     //     std::cerr << "TCP\n";
00104     //   }
00105     //   else if(socketType == UDP)
00106     //   {
00107     //     std::cerr << "UDP\n";
00108     //   }
00109     //   else
00110     //   {
00111     //     std::cerr << "Unknown\n";
00112     //   }
00113 }

00156 void Socket::Listen()
00157 {
00158     int res;
00159     if((res = listen(descriptor, BACKLOG)) == SOCKET_ERROR)
00160         throw SocketException("listen", Errno());

00163 Socket* Socket::Accept()
00164 {
00165     // Variables to use the select function on our descriptor
00166     timeval timeout;
00167     fd_set fds;
00168     int nReady;
00169     int MaxDesc = 0;    // Maximal descriptor for the select function
00170
00171     // REVIEW : a revoir...
00172     struct sockaddr_in the_addr;
00173     int size = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in);
00174     SOCKET new_fd;
00175
00176     // ok, we will wait for an accept attempt for 100 ms
00177     timeout.tv_sec = 0;
00178     timeout.tv_usec = 100000;
00179
00180     FD_ZERO(&fds);
00181     FD_SET( descriptor, &fds );
00182
00183 #ifndef WIN32
00184     MaxDesc = descriptor + 1;
00185 #else
00186     // On WIN32 plateform, the value is unused and remain 0
00187 #endif
00188 
00189     // Ok, wait for the connection...
00190     nReady = select(MaxDesc, &fds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
00191
00192     // If our socket can accept a connection...
00193     if ( nReady > 0 )
00194     {
00195         new_fd = accept(descriptor, (struct sockaddr*)&the_addr, (socklen_t*)&size);
00196         Socket* s = new OMISCID_TLM Socket();
00197         if ( s )
00198         {
00199             s->SetDescriptor(new_fd);
00200             return s;
00201         }
00202         // else we will return NULL at the end of the function
00203     }
00204
00205     // ok, nothing to accept, go up to see if there is a pending request...
00206     return NULL;
00207 }

00209 const SimpleString Socket::GetConnectedHost()
00210 {
00211     struct hostent *he;
00212     struct sockaddr_in addr;
00213     socklen_t namelen = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in);
00214
00215     if ( descriptor < 0 || socketType != TCP ) // All kind of errors
00216         return SimpleString::EmptyString;
00217
00218     if ( ConnectedHost.GetLength() == 0 )
00219     {
00220         // Try to get the peername
00221         if ( getpeername( descriptor, (sockaddr*)&addr, &namelen ) == SOCKET_ERROR )
00222         {
00223             return SimpleString::EmptyString;
00224         }
00225
00226         // Ok, let's get the name of the connected host
00227
00228         he = gethostbyaddr((char *) &addr.sin_addr, 4, AF_INET);
00229         if ( he == NULL )
00230         {
00231             return SimpleString::EmptyString;
00232         }
00233
00234         ConnectedHost = he->h_name;
00235     }
00236
00237     return ConnectedHost;
00238 }

00244
00245 bool Socket::FillAddrIn(struct sockaddr_in * pAdd, const SimpleString name, int port)
00246 {
00247     struct hostent *he;
00248
00249     if ( pAdd == NULL || port < 0 )
00250         return false;
00251
00252     pAdd->sin_family = AF_INET;
00253 #ifdef WIN32
00254     pAdd->sin_port = htons((u_short)port);
00255 #else
00256     pAdd->sin_port = htons((uint16_t)port);
00257 #endif
00258     if ( name.GetLength() == 0 )        // name == ""
00259     {
00260         // Brodcast
00261         pAdd->sin_addr.s_addr = INADDR_ANY;
00262     }
00263     else
00264     {
00265         he = GetHostByName(name);
00266         pAdd->sin_addr = *((struct in_addr*)he->h_addr);
00267     }
00268     memset(&(pAdd->sin_zero), 0, 8);
00269
00270     return true;
00271 }

00273 void Socket::Connect(const SimpleString addr, int port)
00274 {
00275     if(socketType == TCP)
00276     {
00277         struct sockaddr_in the_addr;
00278         FillAddrIn(&the_addr, addr, port);
00279
00280         if(connect(descriptor, (struct sockaddr*)&the_addr, sizeof(struct sockaddr)) == SOCKET_ERROR)
00281         {
00282 #ifdef DEBUG
00283             SimpleString Mesg;
00284             Mesg = "connect to ";
00285             Mesg += addr;
00286             Mesg += ":";
00287             Mesg += port;
00288             throw SocketException(Mesg, Errno());
00289 #else
00290             throw SocketException("connect", Errno());
00291 #endif
00292         }
00293     }
00294     else /* UDP */
00295     {
00296         /*dest.sin_family = AF_INET;
00297         dest.sin_port = htons(port);
00298         dest.sin_addr = *((struct in_addr*)he->h_addr);
00299         //.s_addr = inet_addr(addr);
00300         memset(&(dest.sin_zero), 0, 8); */
00301         FillAddrIn(&dest, addr, port);
00302     }
00303 }

00305 void Socket::Close()
00306 {
00307 #ifdef WIN32
00308     ::shutdown(descriptor, SD_BOTH);
00309     closesocket(descriptor);
00310 #else
00311     shutdown(descriptor, SHUT_RDWR);
00312     close(descriptor);
00313 #endif
00314     descriptor = (SOCKET)SOCKET_ERROR;
00315 }

00317 int Socket::Recv(int len, unsigned char* buf, struct sockaddr_in* pfrom)
00318 {
00319     int res = 0;
00320     if(socketType == TCP)
00321     {
00322         if((res = recv(descriptor, (char*)buf, len, 0)) == SOCKET_ERROR)
00323         {
00324             res = Errno();
00325             throw SocketException("recv_sock_stream", res );
00326         }
00327     }
00328     else
00329     {
00330         struct sockaddr_in from;
00331         struct sockaddr_in* fromptr = (pfrom)? pfrom : &from;
00332         int from_len = sizeof(struct sockaddr);
00333         if((res = recvfrom(descriptor, (char*)buf, len, 0,
00334             (struct sockaddr*)fromptr, (socklen_t*)&from_len)) == SOCKET_ERROR)
00335         {
00336             throw SocketException("recv_sock_dgram", Errno());
00337         }
00338     }
00339     return res;
00340 }
00341
00342 int Socket::Send(int len, const char* buf)
00343 {
00344     const int socket_send_flag = MSG_NOSIGNAL;
00345     int res = 0;                // as gcc on gentoo seems not understand that this will be initialised
00346
00347     if ( len <= 0 || buf == (const char*)NULL )
00348     {
00349         return SOCKET_ERROR;
00350     }
00351
00352     if ( socketType == TCP )
00353     {
00354         if ( len > (TCP_BUFFER_SIZE-1) )
00355         {
00356             int TotalLen = 0;
00357
00358             // Send all parts of the message in maximum TCP_BUFFER_SIZE frame
00359             // Let's send data... For linux, we can not send it as a single call to
00360             // send, so let's do it the other way... Naggle will do the rest...
00361             while( TotalLen < len )
00362             {
00363                 if ( (len-TotalLen) >= (TCP_BUFFER_SIZE-1) )    // 60 Ko
00364                 {
00365                     res = send(descriptor, (char*)(buf+TotalLen), (TCP_BUFFER_SIZE-1), socket_send_flag );
00366                 }
00367                 else
00368                 {
00369                     res = send(descriptor, (char*)(buf+TotalLen), len-TotalLen, socket_send_flag );
00370                 }
00371
00372                 if ( res == SOCKET_ERROR )
00373                 {
00374                     throw SocketException("send_sock_stream", Errno());
00375                 }
00376                 TotalLen += res;
00377             }
00378         }
00379         else
00380         {
00381             if ( (res = send(descriptor, buf, len, socket_send_flag)) == SOCKET_ERROR )
00382             {
00383                 throw SocketException("send_sock_stream", Errno());
00384             }
00385         }
00386     }
00387     else
00388     {
00389         if((res = sendto(descriptor, buf, len, socket_send_flag,
00390             (struct sockaddr*)&dest, sizeof(struct sockaddr))) == SOCKET_ERROR)
00391         {
00392             throw SocketException("send_sock_dgram", Errno());
00393         }
00394     }
00395     return res;
00396 }

00398 int Socket::SendTo(int len, const char* buf, struct sockaddr_in* adest)
00399 {
00400     const int socket_send_flag = MSG_NOSIGNAL;
00401     int res;
00402
00403     if((res = sendto(descriptor, buf, len, socket_send_flag,
00404         (struct sockaddr*)adest, sizeof(struct sockaddr))) == SOCKET_ERROR)
00405     {
00406         throw SocketException("send_sock_dgram", Errno());
00407     }
00408     return res;
00409 }

00411
00412 bool Socket::Select()
00413 {
00414     // Done, change it to non full blocking mode....
00415     fd_set socketfds;
00416
00417     timeval timeout;
00418
00419     FD_ZERO(&socketfds);
00420     FD_SET(descriptor, &socketfds);
00421
00422     // First check for event (like disconnection...)
00423     timeout.tv_sec = 0;
00424     timeout.tv_usec = 10;       // 10 micro seconds
00425
00426     // Ask if some event are waiting on this socket
00427     if ( select((int)descriptor+1, NULL, NULL, &socketfds, &timeout) > 0 )
00428     {
00429         // Ok, something happens
00430         throw SocketException("select", Errno());
00431     }
00432
00433     timeout.tv_sec = 0;
00434     timeout.tv_usec = 100000;   // 100 ms
00435
00436     FD_ZERO(&socketfds);
00437     FD_SET(descriptor, &socketfds);
00438
00439     if( select((int)descriptor+1, &socketfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout) == SOCKET_ERROR )
00440     {
00441         // A problem occurs
00442         throw SocketException("select", Errno());
00443     }
00444
00445     return FD_ISSET(descriptor, &socketfds);
00446 }
00447
00448 unsigned short Socket::GetPortNb()
00449 {
00450     struct sockaddr_in name;
00451     socklen_t size = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in);
00452     memset(&name, 0, size);
00453     if(getsockname(descriptor, (struct sockaddr*)&name, &size))
00454         throw SocketException("getsockname", Errno());
00455
00456     return ntohs(name.sin_port);
00457 }

00476
00477 const SimpleString Socket::RemoveLocalDomain( const SimpleString Name, bool& Modified )
00478 {
00479     int Pos;
00480     SimpleString TmpS(Name);
00481
00482     // Say that we do not modify it
00483     Modified = false;
00484
00485     // seek .local.
00486     Pos = TmpS.Find( ".local." );
00487     if ( Pos != -1 && (Pos+7) == (int)TmpS.GetLength() )
00488     {
00489         // Ok we found "xxx.local."
00490         Modified = true;
00491         return TmpS.SubString( 0, Pos );
00492     }
00493
00494     // seek .local.
00495     Pos = TmpS.Find( ".local" );
00496     if ( Pos != -1 && (Pos+6) == (int)TmpS.GetLength() )
00497     {
00498         // Ok we found "xxx.local"
00499         Modified = true;
00500         return TmpS.SubString( 0, Pos );
00501     }
00502
00503     return TmpS;
00504 }
00505
00506 const SimpleString Socket::RemoveDnsSdDaemonNumber( const SimpleString Name, bool& Modified )
00507 {
00508     int PosDeb;                 // Position of '-\d+' in the string
00509
00510     // Say that we do not modify it
00511     Modified = false;
00512
00513     bool PreviousSequenceOfNumber = false;      // give information about the fact we have numbers before
00514     int SizeOfNum = 0;                                          // number of characters in the sequence '-\d+'
00515     // Start from end
00516     for( PosDeb = Name.GetLength()-1; PosDeb >= 2; PosDeb-- )
00517     {
00518         if ( Name[PosDeb] == '-' )
00519         {
00520             if ( PreviousSequenceOfNumber == true )
00521             {
00522                 // Ok, we've got '-\d+', do the modification
00523                 Modified = true;
00524                 return Name.SubString(0,PosDeb) + Name.SubString(PosDeb+1+SizeOfNum,Name.GetLength() );
00525             }
00526             // ok, the next previous is '-', so not a number
00527             PreviousSequenceOfNumber = false;
00528             SizeOfNum = 0;
00529         }
00530         if ( Name[PosDeb] >= '0' && Name[PosDeb] <= '9' )
00531         {
00532             // Ok, we've got a number
00533             PreviousSequenceOfNumber = true;
00534             SizeOfNum++;
00535             continue;
00536         }
00537         // ok, this is not a number
00538         PreviousSequenceOfNumber = false;
00539         SizeOfNum = 0;
00540     }
00541
00542     return Name;
00543 }
00544
00545 hostent* Socket::GetHostByName( const SimpleString name )
00546 {
00547     struct hostent *he;
00548     SimpleString SearchName = name;
00549     bool IsModified;
00550
00551     if ( GetDynamicNameSolving() == OMISCIDNS_USE_MDNS_NAME_SOLVING )
00552     {
00553         // Try to solve name !
00554         if((he = ::gethostbyname(SearchName.GetStr())) != (struct hostent*)NULL )
00555         {
00556             return he;
00557         }
00558
00559         // Here try to cope with multiple DnsSd deamon running on the
00560         // same computer (like Avahi *AND* mDNS).
00561         SearchName = RemoveDnsSdDaemonNumber( SearchName, IsModified );
00562         if ( IsModified == false )
00563         {
00564             return (struct hostent*)NULL;
00565         }
00566
00567         if((he = ::gethostbyname(SearchName.GetStr())) == (struct hostent*)NULL )
00568         {
00569             SimpleString Mesg = "GetHostByName : ";
00570             Mesg += name;
00571             throw SocketException(Mesg, Errno());
00572         }
00573         return he;
00574     }
00575
00576     // remove try to remove ".local." at end
00577     SearchName = RemoveLocalDomain( SearchName, IsModified );
00578     if((he = ::gethostbyname((char*)SearchName.GetStr())) != (struct hostent*)NULL )
00579     {
00580         // ok
00581         return he;
00582     }
00583
00584     // try to remove number in case of several DnsSdDaemon
00585     SearchName = RemoveDnsSdDaemonNumber( SearchName, IsModified );
00586     if ( IsModified == false )
00587     {
00588         SimpleString Mesg = "GetHostByName : ";
00589         Mesg += name;
00590         throw SocketException(Mesg, Errno());
00591     }
00592
00593     if((he = ::gethostbyname((char*)SearchName.GetStr())) == (struct hostent*)NULL )
00594     {
00595         SimpleString Mesg = "GetHostByName : ";
00596         Mesg += name;
00597         throw SocketException(Mesg, Errno());
00598     }
00599
00600     return he;
00601 }
00602
00603 bool Socket::SetTcpNoDelay(bool Set)
00604 {
00605     if ( descriptor == SOCKET_ERROR || socketType != TCP )
00606     {
00607         return false;
00608     }
00609     int OptVal;
00610     if ( Set == true )
00611     {
00612         OptVal = 1;
00613     }
00614     else
00615     {
00616         OptVal = 0;
00617     }
00618
00619 #ifdef WIN32
00620     if ( setsockopt(descriptor, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, (char*)&OptVal, sizeof(OptVal)) < 0 )
00621     {
00622         OmiscidError("setsockopt: could not set TCP nodelay\n");
00623         return false;
00624     }
00625     return true;
00626 #else
00627     struct protoent *p;
00628     p = getprotobyname("tcp");
00629     if ( p && setsockopt(descriptor, p->p_proto, TCP_NODELAY, &OptVal, sizeof(OptVal)) < 0)
00630     {
00631         OmiscidError("setsockopt: could not set TCP nodelay\n");
00632         return false;
00633     }
00634     return true;
00635 #endif
00636 }
